intro: Psychotria balbisiana var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of forests. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. This species is part of the Rubiaceae family and is known for its chemical compounds, some of which have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
